title: Kuro
occurrences: She shortened 'Kuroko' to 'Kuro' and began calling Mr. Ono - Kuro! Kuro!
but it was laughable to think of Kuro as invisible when he so clearly appeared more visible by the day.
Milou moved out of the apartment, and Romi stayed behind with Kuro...
...and so began her life alone with Kuro.
Kuro was completely black.
Kuro left the food untouched...
By then she had stopped taking Kuro to the toilet altogether.
Back home, Kuro is lying weakly in the dirty bed.
It made her shudder to think of the state of Kuro's skin,
Even at dinner, Kuro would not eat.
Romi tries to feed him, but Kuro is unresponsive.
It's as if Kuro no longer has a mouth, nose, nor eyes.
Romi smeared the food over Kuro's face as if playing a childish game.
Romi and Kuro quietly spent the following days in much the same way.
Whenever the now filthy Kuro moved around, a putrid odour filled the air.
As the days went by Kuro grew ever weaker and dishevelled.
Romi had decided that there was nothing she could do to help and let Kuro be...
...or rather, Romi gradually began confining Kuro in his room.
One afternoon, Romi opens Kuro's door for the first time in quite some time.
Upon seeing her, Kuro languidly tries to get up.
As Kuro struggled to lift his body from the bed,
...but she closed Kuro's door and uttered
- Kuro's family are here visiting. Go home and don't worry about us.
Moving the bookshelf to one side, she opened Kuro's now somewhat darkened door.
Romi entered to find Kuro lying in the dark. She drew closer and slowly held him up.
Kuro seemed visibly smaller,
Romi carried Kuro to the living room window, and as if to reminisce,
Kuro was motionless.
She brought a plastic bag and placed Kuro's head inside, tying it down with a handkerchief around his neck.
Romi tried to sit Kuro up, only for him to fall over immediately.
She tied the handkerchief to the curtain rail, hanging Kuro upright.
Kuro now resembled a sweet little paper doll.
Romi became so engrossed in the film that she quickly forgot about Kuro.
She woke the next morning and was taken aback to find Kuro hanging there in the morning light.
Romi poured detergent on the now conveniently-sized Kuro, and washed him in the sink.
Seeing as Kuro had frayed, she affectionately began to tape around his head,
Kuro had become a peculiar shape.
The next morning, as Romi went to water the plant, Kuro took no notice of her and rolled about in a slumber.
Romi could see that new lumps had formed on Kuro's neck and down towards his back.
Milou embraced her tightly, and rushed towards Kuro's bedroom.
Inside, Kuro is nowhere to be seen.
Despite looking in all the rooms, Milou cannot find Kuro.
- Where did Kuro go?
That night, they no longer talked of Kuro, not even mentioning his name.
- Yesterday, I lost Kuro in the park.
- Let's find Kuro.
Kuro must be here somewhere.
As they search the area, they find Kuro lying on the left hand side, by the opening in the bushes.
Milou ran towards Kuro, wrapped him in a blanket and held him up.
Kuro is dishevelled and worn out.
and roll the blanket-wrapped Kuro onto the backseat.
...soon, despite the fully open windows, Kuro's stench became so unbearable
Romi and Milou roll the wrapped Kuro down onto the sand, and Romi begins arranging the picnic.
As if having a sudden idea, Milou unwraps Kuro and rolls him out towards the water.
They laugh as Kuro splashes into the waves.
Milou brings a cable from the car and ties Kuro to a washed up tree trunk.
Romi and Milou lift Kuro out of the water.
Washed by the waves, Kuro is peeling and resembles a large, tangled clump of seaweed.
Once home, after drying Kuro thoroughly and putting him to bed,
finds Kuro's room empty, the bed coated in a pale black stain.
Kuro is missing.
Squinting, I can make out Kuro lying down in the middle of the rooftop,
Romi walks between the plants, and as she gets closer, holds Kuro in her arms.
and lays Kuro down on the pail.
Kuro melds into the dirt.
